thread.title: Man, 22, fights for life after Newcastle stabbing
thread.title_full: Man, 22, fights for life after Newcastle stabbing | Tyne Tees - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Man, 22, fights for life after Newcastle stabbing
text:
A man is in a critical condition after a stabbing in Newcastle city centre.
A 22-year-old man was stabbed at Princess Square on 20 February at around 1.20pm.
Emergency services attended and the man was taken to hospital with life threatening injuries. He remains in a critical condition in hospital.
Enquiries into the incident are ongoing and a number of people are helping police with their enquiries.
"This was a very serious assault and a man is still in hospital with life-threatening injuries.
"We have five people in custody but we still need to speak to anyone who was in the area at the time so we can paint an accurate picture of what exactly happened.
"The incident itself happened in Princess Square so we are confident that members of the public would have seen those involved in the moments leading up to and following the attack.
"We would appeal for anyone who saw what happened, or has any information that may help police, to get in touch with us as soon as possible."
â€“ Senior investigating officer, Superintendent John Bent Police at the scene Credit: ITV A cordon is in place and officers will remain at the scene as specialist detectives carry out their enquiries.
Extra officers will also be on patrol in the area of Princess Square to reassure members of the public and residents living in the area.
Anyone with any information is asked to contact Northumbria Police on 101.
Latest update: police have now lifted the cordon on Princess Square but patrols are still in the area (21st February, 9.46pm) Newcastle
